newsitem.title: UK: Shield seeks FDA heart-attack test approval.
newsitem.headline: Shield seeks FDA heart-attack test approval.

text.p: Britain's Shield Diagnostics Group Plc said on Monday it had submitted an application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for approval of its proprietary AFT cardiovascular disease diagnostics test.
Shield said it expected approval from the FDA before the end of the year.
George Zajicek, Shield's marketing director, said the company was meeting its marketing targets for AFT (Activated Factor Twelve).
Shield says studies show patients with coronary heart disease had 30 percent higher levels of AFT -- a key clotting agent -- in their blood than healthy people.
Shield, based in Dundee, Scotland, has developed the only-known test for AFT. It believes the test will prove more accurate than existing cholesterol tests.
